GameObjects

Class SpaceShip

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameObjects.GameObject
      • GameObjects.SpaceShip

  • public class SpaceShip
extends GameObject
    The SpaceShip child class differentiates itself from Projectiles in that it has various additions that allow greater control over the movement of the GameObject, and graphical display.
    Author:
    Mason Dumaine

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean isMoving 
      protected boolean isVisible 
      int rowCounter 
      private int thrustCounter 

      • Fields inherited from class GameObjects.GameObject

        hitbox, objectColor, size, xPos, xVel, yPos, yVel

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SpaceShip()
      Default constructor for the SpaceShip just uses the default super constructor to initialize the data members.
      SpaceShip(int xPos, int yPos, int size, java.awt.Color c)
      The constructor for this child class just passes values up to the superclass.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void drawObject(java.awt.Graphics pen)
      drawObject() is responsible for drawing the base of the ship (a square) and the thruster animation for the ship.
      boolean getIsMoving()
      Getter for if the ship is moving or not.
      void move()
      move() both modifies the x,y position of the ship based on it's velocities, and updates the hitbox's position.
      void setIsMoving(boolean mov)
      Simple setter for if the ship is moving or not.
      void setIsVisible(boolean vis)
      Simple setter for if the ship is visible or not.

        Parameters:
        xPos - X position where the ship is centered.
        yPos - Y position where the ship is centered.
        size - The size of the square ship.
        c - The color of the ship.
